feed.title: Hosted Private Cloud Status - Incident History

entry.title: [Global][Dedicated Cloud] - End of Life Dedicated Cloud
entry.content:
THIS IS A SCHEDULED EVENT Dec 19, 10:00 UTC  -  Dec 20, 10:00 UTC

Jul 25, 13:27 UTC
Scheduled - End of Life Dedicated Cloud: 30 September 2022
We informed you in October 2021 that our Dedicad Cloud service will reach its end of life and will be discontinued the 30st September 2022. This step is important for your VMware platforms to improve the quality of service, performance, and security of your clusters. Indeed, "Dedicated Cloud" hardware used, pre-2016, does not allow us to provide the best level of service and integration with new modern architectures of VMware.
Following our previous email, many customers started to plan and/or to migrate and we encourage you to do the same to avoid the September deadline.

Guide to migrating to a new infrastructure:
https://docs.ovh.com/gb/en/private-cloud/vdc-migration/

entry.title: [Rbx2][Hosted Private Cloud] - 29A02
entry.content:
Nov 1, 21:05 UTC
Resolved - Start time : 01/11/2022 20:16 UTC
End time : 01/11/2022 21:00 UTC
Service status : All Hosts are operational again.
Services are working as they should be.
Root cause: It was due to a malfunction on the cooling system.

Nov 1, 20:26 UTC
Investigating - Start time : 01/11/2022 20:16 UTC
Service impact : Some Hosts are unreachable.
Ongoing actions : Our technical teams are working on the issue. Update will be post as significant progress is made.

entry.title: [Global][VMware] - Curative maintenance relating to VMSA-2022-0027
entry.content:
Oct 26, 08:19 UTC
Completed - The scheduled maintenance has been completed.

Oct 26, 08:18 UTC
Scheduled - Start time : 26/10/2022 07:35 UTC
End time : 26/10/2022 07:45 UTC
Service impact : This maintenance has had an impact on all access to NSX APIs, and on the management of features such as ipsec VPN, which can only be managed by API.
Service improvement : OVHcloud’s statement about VMSA-2022-0027
Product: HPC VMware NSX

A critical VMSA has been released by VMware: https://www.vmware.com/security/advisories/VMSA-2022-0027.html
This VMSA is impacting NSX-V, allowing non-authorized person to authenticate on the NSX, meaning access to all customer datas, etc.

By design, Our Private Cloud infrastructures are protected from any connection not whitelisted by the customer. However, we couldn’t stand in front of a 9.8 CVSS without making sure everything is secured.
That’s why we maintained a restriction on NSX APIs that has been applied few days ago, forbidding anyone to connect to NSX itself and so making sure all infrastructures are protected.

The only fix provided for now by VMware is the upgrade to the new version: 6.4.14.
We integrated this version and this will be deployed globally to all Private Clouds within the next weeks. As always, you will receive a communication about the date when you will receive this upgrade.

We are sorry for any inconvenience created by this protection.

entry.title: [RBX][Google Anthos] - API
entry.content:
Oct 23, 11:07 UTC
Resolved - Start Time : 23/10/2022 08:39 UTC
End Time : 23/10/2022 11:02 UTC
Service impact: APIs are available again

Oct 23, 09:09 UTC
Investigating - Start time: 23/10/2022 08:39 UTC
User impact : We are experiencing degradations on the APIs of the Google Anthos offering. It is currently impossible to edit clusters. Clusters continue to operates
Ongoing Actions: Our teams investigate to determine the origin of the damage

Thank you for your understanding

OVHcloud Technical team
